awd_titl_txt: Extension of Time Series at 21 Degrees N. East Pacific Rise to 1991/1192
awd_abstract_narration: This project will continue the time series study of the vent            fluids at the hydrothermal site located a 21 degrees north on the               East Pacific Rise.  Since this hydrothermal site was discovery in               1979 three expeditions to this location have established that the               exit temperatures and distinct interfield differences in fluid                  composition have remained constant with time at the four vent                   fields.  This project will allow the principal investigator to                  document any changes in chemistry and temperature at each site                  and will extend the study of this hydrothermal system to over a                 decade.  The results will improve understanding of the evolution                of seafloor hydrothermal systems and will further constrain the                 processes that control the hydrothermal fluxes of elements into                 the oceans.
